Reviews.Title: “So sad it's going away!”
Reviews.Author: DCSuzp
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying here in three years. Reasonably priced for a perfect location, right on the beach, and away from the ferry docks. But unfortunately, huge new condos will be built on this property, beginning very soon. So get your time in now!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella1980
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap place to sleep this is it...no extra frills. The rooms were basic but clean. One out of the three rooms we reserved had hot water...the others had luke warm water most of the time. Air conditioning was good for all but one day. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beach out front is lacking...lots of seaweed and boats but if you don't mind getting through that not bad. Their chair selection on the beach is pretty rough...lots of them were broken! Would we stay again? Probably...the price was right and I think we could have got them down on that too if we had known that most places were not to full capacity...we stayed feb 8-19th. They will be tearing this hotel down in April though...yet another mega complex will be built in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “nice beach and close to all places to go out”
Reviews.Author: bkchill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the standard room of this hotel for 5 nights and it was great. Very clean and spacy rooms, free deck-chairs and towels on the beach. Although it was almost next to a club you didn't hear the noise in the room. With a fan and AC it was equipped perfectly. I would surely go back there. I think one of the best deals directly on the beach and around the area.

Reviews.Title: “The happiest place on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Elenberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Beach over New Years. We had an upstairs beach front bungalow and our friends stayed in one of the rooms facing the street. Overall we loved it. The location couldn't be better, the beach is one the few left with palm trees, so you can get a little shade during the afternoon. Everyone is very friendly. There is construction going on, but like someone else mentioned this is Playa del Carmen. The rooms are basic but clean. The restaurant next door was fun to have for those mandatory drinks and guacamole. We would definitely go back but we have heard that the property sold and will probably be torn down so hurry up and go if you want to experience the Blue Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ali21
Reviews.Content: We where very happy with the Blue Beach Hotel! We had a one bedroom apartment on the beach!! There is continuing construction across the street from the hotel but if you request a room on the beach you wont hear a thing!! Rooms where basic but clean and comfortable. Staff where very friendly and helpful. There was a happy hour everyday and reasonably priced food. The hotel has a very relaxed atmosphere not for someone looking for a luxury getaway! We had a brilliant holiday would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Priced right - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and use trip advisor to get honest reviews before I book at any hotel I am unfamiliar with. I love this website. But anyway; We have been to Cancun 3 times and thought maybe we'd try Playa. I'll never go back to Cancun again. My husband and I stayed at El Dorado Suites for 4 nights during the first week of Dec. we really liked the quaintness of Playa Del Carmen and decided to bring our 3 kids 18, 16, and 7 back for Christmas. It wasn't easy to find availability in some of the All-Inclusive resorts so I started looking at the smaller hotels and found Blue Beach Club. It was the best looking (from their website) beachfront property in the town of Playa available so I booked it. The first night we stayed in an oceanfront room. It was O.K. Definately oceanfront! It was clean but too small for my family so we upgraded to a suite. Only $65 more per night. It was located directly above the small restaurant they have. It was very nice. We had a seperate bedroom w/ bathroom. A bedroom area with a dbl. bed, a pull-out sofa bed in the "living area", and another bathroom. We had a kitchenette with a frig, stove, microwave, sink, and a breakfast bar. It was well equiped with dishes, pots and pans and silverware. It overlooked the ocean. It had a balcony with a hammock, table and 4 chairs and a wonderful breeze. The beachfront restaurant is small but the food is genuinely mexican, it's very fresh (we saw the pick-up truck drive up and sell them fish (some stlill alive). The breakfast is only $3.99 and more than the average person could ever eat. Coffee is great, but isn't all coffee great when your sitting next to the ocean? The beach is public and yes there are fishing boats directly in front of the hotel but there aren't any in front of the hotel next door- maybe a 100' ft. to your right. Really it's no big deal. My kids played in the ocean all day and were in plain sight from our lounge chairs. The staff was wonderful, very accomodating. Our drinks were always fresh and the staff would be there the minute you even looked like you needed something. Very friendly! Jose at the front desk was wonderful and came up to us more than once during our stay to ask if everything was OK. (by the way- he didn't know I was a travel agent until check-out) so his intentions were genuine. This hotel wasn't what my kids are used to. We usually stay at mega all-inclusive resorts when they travel w/ us, but honestly we had a much better time. We were together w/out all of the distractions of 5 pools and the video arcade. Overall if your looking for excitement and a high energy place- don't stay here. If your looking for laid-back "Margaritaville" this is the place. We also loved the fact that we were directly on the beach and also within 2 blocks of 5th avenue. (My teenagers also loved the location). I would definately recommend this hotel to my clients (depending on their needs, expectations and budget). This place is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “blue beach hotel---returning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the blue beach hotel is in a superior location on the beach just two blocks from the premier spots on fifth avenue. great spot for seniors, families and fun lovers. staff most capable and accomidating. the cantina and senor elder are a sccret jewel to visit throughout your stay. we had two units. me/ grampa on the beach...daughter , husband and two brilliant grand children had a two bedroom appartment. all this was in spring 2006. we are all booked at th blue beach for january 2007. that's as good as it gets. we are going back in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their Master Suites in February 2006. We faced the street, and were on the ground floor, so had no view of the ocean, but that was fine. Construction of a new condo complex right across the street began at 7am every day, and continued until after dusk. But, of the 40 or so workers, nobody had power tools, so after awakening the first morning to the sound of unexpected construction, it became routine to wake up daily to the sound of hammering, and then drift off for another hour or two of sleep. Geez, construction in Playa? Get used to it. It's a booming town. There is construction everywhere. The day would usually begin with my wife and I walking down to the beach (about 25 paces away) to the hotel's beach bar/restaurant, and enjoying breakfast. Then it was back to the room for some sun lotion, or a walk further into town for groceries, or just relaxation. Then before lunch we'd wander back to the beach and find a couple of vacant lawn chaises (definitely in short supply for the hotel...only a dozen or so). Drinks & lunch on the beach set up some great r & r in the afternoon. The boats anchored just offshore were not a concern, simply adding to the charm of the location. The water was warm and incredibly clear, and quite shallow. I would walk out about 100 yards from shore, and it was still only waist-deep. And what a great location. Short walking distance to 5th Ave., which I loved, with all of its bars and restaurants. I'd give the hotel a 3.5 if I could. It's trying to be a 4, but I can't give it that. Yet, the location is great, and yes, I'd stay there again, and definitely would return to PDC, in a heartbeat. Thanks to Juan Carlos and the guys. The maids were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for your money”
Reviews.Author: westies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the beach. If you get a upper story room, you can look right out to the ocean, plus get a nice breeze, they have air condition and a ceiling fan, you can use either or both. We used both. Rooms are clean and spacious, maid service was excellent, has tv with cable and nice balcony, beds are very comfy, would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat when we go again to Playa, cheaper than Cancun hotels and close to beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised or Reserved.”
Reviews.Author: GampaRick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple booked a master suite, garden view, for Feb. 3 thru Feb. 9 of 2006. We booked this in August of 2006 and had a reservation and confirmation number. Upon arrival on the 3rd we were advised that our Master suite was not available until the 4th. After registering our disapproval, to no avail, we were given two Superior suites for the first night. The next day we were given a Master Suite, not a garden view, but a view of the street and the construction site across the street. Our rooms refrigerator just barely worked and the showers water pressure was very inconsistent, going from nothing, to a trickle, to a good stream. It also varied in temperature from very hot to cold. Suffice it to say that we did NOT get what we reserved and what the web site advertises. Although we stayed there and had a good time we would not go back there. On the plus side the maid service was excellent and the support staff were very pleasant and helpful. What was most disturbing was the reservation not being what was reserved and no apology or explanation offered. So even with a guaranteed reservation at Blue Beach you may not get what you think you reserved. We did not find the boats tied up at the beach in front of the resort to be a problem as others have indicated in previous posts. Blue Beach has a distinct lack of beach chairs available in relation to the number of rooms / occupants. This can be an issue if one wants to spend time on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, husband, and two kids ages 6 and 3) went to Playa Del Carmen last spring, and are planning our next trip there again this summer! We found Blue Beach via the internet and liked the location and price,and we are easy to please so we figured we could handle any less-than-awesome lodging. We were so pleasantly surprised by how nice our Junior Suite turned out to be! The kids got "their own room"(they shared the futon) and the shower was big enough for all 4 of us to spray off after playing on the beach. Sure there was a little rust here and there and the kitchen appliances/utensils were a little out of date, but I was grateful for the fridge and the dinette set and hey--we go to Mexico not for perfect sparkling accomodations, but the perfect sparkling Caribbean waters! The kids loved that we could hop our little patio wall and be right there on the beach. There were some small fishing boats tied up right there, and some might not like that, but our son was in heaven watching the "boat dudes", and we could sit right at a little table in the shade sipping pina coladas while they buried each other in the sand right in front of us. I never worried about security there at all....we put anything of value in the safe that is in the room. We only walked about 1/4 mile at the most up the beach to a nice wide area for laying out and playing in the water. And the amount of incredible shops and restaurants that are within EASY walking distance will make your head spin. We took a cab to the ferry dock for only a few bucks and the ferry to Cozumel is enjoyable and cheap too. DO NOT GO HERE if you don't like to get friendly with locals, or if you require pristine lodging, or if you aren't adventurous about trying new foods in all the great little hidden treasures around town (expensive all-inclusives are for you!) The people are beautiful, and don't be afraid to use that little dusty bit of Spanish you know! They are happy that people will at least try! We LOVE Playa Del Carmen and DEFINITELY plan on staying at the Blue Beach Hotel again, and next time we are bringing more family and friends with us!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: Lov2BinPlaya
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the blue beach many,many times. If your looking for a all inclusive up tight place this is not for you. Its great for lovers and families.Your right on the beach with in walking distance to everything. Our host everytime we have ever stayed has been Jaun carlos. He is a wonderful host and the staff is terrific. He is always ready to guide you to what ever your looking for. We like the laid back atmosphere and the large rooms and kitchens. We bring a few amenities from home for cooking, but there is a Sam's club and a huge market with anything you can think of. A couple of items I reccomend, bring a big beach towel, a decent teflon pan.They have coffee makers available. however, 30 steps from your room they have a great little cafe right on the beach. next store is a jumpin' reggae bar/eatery. We like both places, and the beer is always cold and cheap.If you want super fancy and uptight, please don't come to Playa, go to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A nice beach front hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scubagrl
Reviews.Content: Spent the day (not night) at Blue Beach while on a cruise. Had a "garden view" room. No garden view - only view of side street with construction. But the beach front views were very nice. If I was spending the night, I would have gotten the beach front or the beach front bungalow right on the beach. Front desk person was very nice. I only spent about 4 hrs there, but it was a very nice room with clean bathroom and large shower. Not much beach in front of hotel - but none of the beach up and down was very nice. Believe you have to go a lot further south or maybe more north to get really nice beach. Hate shopping in Playa Del Carmen. Wish the Mexican merchants would learn that most people just like to look and then decide. Not to be grabbed and practically held prisoner. Therefore, I only shopped in area by taxi stand. It's a shame. Would definitely stay at Blue Beach if I were every to return to Playa Del Carmen area - which is doubtful because of the store merchants.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from Blue Beach Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: yum
Reviews.Content: I must warn you about staying at this hotel. We stayed at Blue Beach for 4 nights. Our $300 camera flash was stolen from our luggage by hotel staff. The hotel room had a safe. When we asked the reception for the key to the safe they told us that there was no key. So everyday we made sure we put our $300 Nikon camera flash deep inside our luggage and closed it up. The last day when we were supposed to take off, we noticed the camera flash was stolen from our luggage. We talked to the manager. He was not helpful and he didn't seem honest. We spoke with the owner of the hotel (he also owns Don Emilione). We wrote him numerous e-mails and he never reponded. If you are considering staying at either of these hotels, I must advise you against it. Better safe than sorry! There are plenty of other options in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Beach, Blue Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel for our Garden View Jr Suite and were placed in a Street side room. No view of any Garden or the Ocean. We complained at the office and were told we needed to call our Travel Agent. We asked to use the phone (no phone in the rooms) They said NO. After looking for 45 min. for a working phone, We called our Agent and were told the hotel hade to help us and there was no refund. We stayed 7 nights and delt with the moldy smell, the lack of hot water, the rust and dirt, and noise from the street. The AC worked great. our total bill for the room was $995.00. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic quarters”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Beach and found it good for the price. We had 4 couples and had each room category covered. The beachfront bugalow ground floor was very convenient to the beach but has zero privacy. The security guard pretty much sat on the front porch all night so you were definitely safe but since there is no a/c you had to have windows open so no privacy. The 2nd floor bungalows were very interesting and rustic but with multiple porches and views...but lots of insects as the roof was bare palapa. The basic room with a/c was a great bargain..thats it. Cold a/c, hot water, cable tv and locks on the door. The junior suite was the same but with a living room. Had no problems with noise or bad smells but we are an easy group. A decent value with a nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “has it's good points as well as bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in a beachfront cabana at blue beach last february. it was just what we expected - not the lap of luxury, but if you are a beach lover, it's perfect as the bungalow is RIGHT ON THE BEACH. It is located next to the coolest nightspot, blue parrot, as well as hot spot Om. the room itself was a nice size, and the bathroom was clean and decorated with great mexican flair. There was no air-conditioning, only a ceiling fan, but it was fine because there was a cool breeze coming in from the ocean. the beds were comfortable, but i dont think the sheets were changed on a nightly basis. we were awakened every morning by people taking beach chairs (chairs are available on a first come first serve basis, even though they left much to be desired) and talking, and were often bothered by this. on a more positive note, even though blue parrot was around the corner, at night the bungalow was as quiet as can be. we slept very well and could hear the ocean - very tranquil. the part of the beach where this hotel is located is nice, but not the best part of the beach. the water is full of boats and the sand isn't perfect. however, you can get corona's/margs/food delivered right to your chair by the little beach bar nearby which was very convenient. INSIDER TIP: everyday around 5pm a corona truck would pull up near the little restaurant and you could buy a case for $20 US. once we stocked up the fridge, we were good to go for a while. overall, i would say DEFINITELY stay at blue beach if you are in a beachfront cabana. otherwise, not highly recommended. we had friends staying off of the beach and complained of a terrible view and noise. also, we decided to extend our stay and were brought to a room located in what looked like the mohavi desert and saw a roach the size of a dinosaur... needless to say, we moved ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Blue after Blue Beach”
Reviews.Author: ABurns
Reviews.Content: We were concerned after reading some of the reviews and rightly so. We had a room on the ground level just a few yards from the beach. We only were there for 3 nights, so we could live with it. We would have certainly complained if it was for longer than 3 nights. Pros: close to beach and to 5th ave with great restaurants. The housekeeping staff is VERY nice and we tipped her well. I kind of felt sorry for her working in such a squalid environment. The housekeeper did clean as well as she could and left the towels on the bed in the shape of a swan or a dog. cons: mold/ mildew smell overpowering. Black mold around the sink, fan squeaked constantly. We forgot our travel alarm and there isn't a phone for wake up calls, or a clock radio. Be prepared for bare-bones at this place. No iron, blow-dryer. Just a tv and a safe deposit box. The other reviews are right on- fishing boats in front of the hotel, and LOTS of kelp. BUT......if you walked a bit further down the beach- wonderful. We didn't complain, so I'm not sure if the problem would have been rectified if we did. The good news is we only slept here and spent most of our time on the beach. Rustic I can handle- this place is a dump. The pictures are not representative of the real deal. We kind of looked at it like we do when we go to Vegas- never in the room, so not that big of a deal. We did save some pesos staying here, but all in all, not that impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the house at Blue Beach !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in the house at Blue Beach, Playa del Carmen, Mexico and will have to say it was one of the BEST vacations we have ever had. The house is located right on the beach and so convenient to restaurants and shopping. We didn't rent a car, so everything was within walking distance. The house is so nice, very spacious and private. We went with 2 other couples and everyone had plenty of room. The people at Blue Beach are very nice and so helpful. You might want to pack some washclothes, because there are none, but everything else is provided. But be sure you don't overpack your bags if you are flying on Frontier airlines because you will be charged $50 for overweight bags, and that info is not readily available to you when booking your flight online. I had to call the airline after we returned to find out where that info is, and it is quite a task to find it. But the stay at Blue Beach made up for the rest of the trip!! If you would like anymore info, please feel free to email me. I found out a lot of info thru a previous guest at Blue Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Blue Beach Hotel with my family (2 adults, 2 kids, 12 & 16). I booked it after reading mostly positive reviews here. We were disappointed with our stay, and would have moved to another hotel, but spring break is busy! We can tolerate "rustic" but our room (master suite) would be better classified as "run down". Pros: Great location on the beach, easy walking distance to 5th Ave with all the shops and restaurants. Cons: Our room was 1st floor, street side. It was noisy location at night, with quite a bit of car and foot traffic. We asked to be moved, but no other rooms were available. Parties going above us two nights-- Although they didn't go past 12:30 or so. (We tend to run and beach it during the day and want to relax at night) Window lock broken--made us nervous as we were on the ground floor. One tv not working at all. Toilet leaked continually. Bad mildew throughout, especially in the bathrooms-yes, I know it's damp there, but some upkeep is needed. Kitchenette not really usable. Frig rusty but worked. One of our room keys disappeared early in the week,which we reported. One swimming suit missing from our room. At check out we were charged for the "missing" room key. Got home and found it inside a suitcase, on top of the contents. If you go, use the lock boxes in the room, and definitely request an upper floor room away from the street. I did not see any of the other rooms at the Blue Beach--maybe some were in better condition than the one we stayed in. We'll try somewhere else next time.

HotelInfo.Name: Blue Beach Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Privada 1a Norte, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
